text: The Bank of California Building is a 1908 Greco-Roman style structure with a brutalist, , 22-story tower annexed in 1967 at 400 California Street in the financial district of San Francisco, California. Union Bank acquired the building in 1996 as part of its merger with Bank of California. ==See also== * List of San Francisco Designated Landmarks * San Francisco's tallest buildings ==References== ==External links== Category:Office buildings completed in 1908 Category:Office buildings completed in 1967 Category:Landmarks in San Francisco Category:Skyscraper office buildings in San Francisco Category:Bliss and Faville buildings Category:Anshen and Allen buildings Category:Financial District, San Francisco Category:1908 establishments in California
title: Bank of California Building (San Francisco)
